item.title: Report X-2024072206
item.description:
Report X-2024072206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Assistant at 042 advised that a pair of pallets arrived damaged to the service center. The pallets were leaking from behind shrink wrap and were likely damaged before being handled by ABF. CURA arrived to clean the spill and the cleaning crew advised that the bags appeared to have been pu nctured by forklift blades before being wrapped.

item.title: Report X-2024072217
item.description:
Report X-2024072217

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS SENT UP THE CONVEYER SYSTEM AND WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING AT THE FIRST TENDER IT CAME TO. THE PRODUCT WAS REMOVED FROM THE BELT AND PLACED ON THE PLATFORM - TWO CONTAINERS STILL IN THE BOX AND TWO OUT. A RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED AND THE SPILL WAS CLEANED UP. UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION DISCOVERED UNDECLARED OXIDIZING LIQUID N.O.S.

item.title: Report X-2024071431
item.description:
Report X-2024071431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of GLB Aqua Silk Chlorine-Free Shock Oxidizer. 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of shock oxidizer was cracked allowing 1 gallon to release. The other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles were not damaged. Each bottle was in its own plastic bag. No slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024070509
item.description:
Report E-2024070509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN2582 Hydrex 3250 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cup of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the tote lid and body only due to a defective cap. The contractors replaced the cap with a new vented cap and wiped the tote down. A slosh test was conducted, and the tote was confirmed to be no longer leaking and was secured for shipment on. The impacted pads and cap were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

PACKAGE WAS A 20 LITER PLASTIC BAG INSIDE A INNER BOX INSIDE THE PACKAGE. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET RIPPED TORN AND LEAKING PACKAGE FOUND ON TRAILER # 958319 ALREADY DAMAGED WET RIPPED TORN AND LEAKING UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS 6 X 2QUART PLASTIC BOTTLES OF ZEP LIQUID HEAT ONE 2QUART PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .50QUARTS TO RELEASE NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024070565
item.description:
Report E-2024070565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XHG contacted ERTS regarding several fallen boxes containing hazardous product, Contact-64. The boxes fell during transit as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. In total, (8) boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon plastic bottles of Contact 64 were damaged and/or impacted by released product. A Contractor estimated that 2-gallons of corrosive liquid released onto adjacent product, packaging including cardboard and shrink wrap/bubble-wrap, and the wooden trailer floor in a 8’x4’ area. Citric Acid was applied as a neutralizer and oil dry was laid down to absorb the release. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024070562
item.description:
Report E-2024070562

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 3-cups of Novacote NC-250/70-A was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture by XWC. The release impacted Dock Door 82. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.
